gw.plugin.contact

Interface IContactSearchAdapter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote
    Deprecated. 
    Since 8.0. This is a legacy plugin for 3rd party CMS integration. Should implement gw.plugin.contact.ContactSystemPlugin instead.

    @Deprecated(value="Since 8.0.  This is a legacy plugin for 3rd party CMS integration. Should implement gw.plugin.contact.ContactSystemPlugin instead.")
public interface IContactSearchAdapter
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    IContactSearchAdapter represents the interface to an external system that performs a search and retreival of contact data.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ExtContactSrchResult searchContacts(ContactSearchCriteria criteria)
      Deprecated. 
      Search a contact store, returning contact summaries that match the supplied criteria.

    • Method Detail

      • searchContacts

        ExtContactSrchResult searchContacts(ContactSearchCriteria criteria)
                                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Search a contact store, returning contact summaries that match the supplied criteria.

        If the search results is too big and causes a performance issue, the adapter should cap the results and set ResultsCapped=true in the returned ExtContactSrchResult. In that happens an appropriate message will be added to the search results UI.

        It is up to the adapter's developer to decide what is the cap based on the performance requirements and resources available. If more then one page or results is returned (as defined in the RowIterator in AddressBookSearchLV.pcf - the default is 15) and the user is paging to the next page, the searchContacts() will be executed again.

        Parameters:
        criteria - Contact search criteria
        Returns:
        A non-null structure containing the contact search results.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
